g.text: K2/Na2 sites lead to almost ideal cubic coordination with
bond lengths and with a difference between
the as-observed narrow emission bands, as discussed
below. The Na3 site has a relatively low symmetry of –4,
leading to distorted cubic coordination. The alkali metal
would lead to an increase in positive
charge of the unit cell; hence, the charge compensation
can be associated with the formation of vacancies in
cations instead of anions, such as 2Na
prevent reliable determination of the mechanism, and
